p: Fibroblast proliferation is essential to the wound healing process. The HE staining images of 7-day-old wound granulation revealed a significant increase of the fibroblast cell density by 1.9 times in the 50 mg/kg/d CCLE-treated group, compared to that of the control group ( Figure 5(a)). Besides, the two CCLE treatment groups also increased TGF- β1 gene expression by 2.2 and 3.3 times, respectively, to 10 mg/kg/d and 50 mg/kg/d doses of CCLE ( Figure 5(b)). TGF- β1 has been reported to be involved in induction on fibroblast proliferation [ 26– 28]. Therefore, the increase of TGF- β1 gene expression is strongly correlated with the increase of the fibroblast number in the HE staining images.
